title: SSH over USB
content: Esse procedimento só funciona com as seguintes raspberrypi disponíveis:  Raspberry Pi Zero Raspberry Pi Zero W  Monte o SD no seu computador e acesse a raiz.  procure pelo /boot  Habilite o SSH  para isso somente crie um arquivo em branco na raiz, como no exemplo abaixo:  touch /boot/ssh  Adicione o driver a configuração do device tree  edite o arquivo config.txt:  vi /boot/config.txt   acrescente a seguinte linha:  dtoverlay=dwc2  Carregue o módulo no boot  edite o arquivo cmdline.txt  vi /boot/cmdline.txt   depois do rootwait, adicione, somente com espaço e sem virgulas, a chamada para os seguintes módulos:  modules-load=dwc2,g_ether  Para logar no Raspberry  coloque de volta o SD no raspberry conecte o cabo usb na porta denominada USB (e não na porta POWER) abra o terminal e digite:  ssh-keygen -R raspberrypi.local ssh pi@raspberrypi.local

title: VMware SDDC
content: VMware SDDC Workshop  This is a tutorial to how deploy and configure VMWare HCX on-premises and how pairing with VMC on AWS to extend networking, migrate VMs in bulk or VMotion mode.

title: Pré-requisitos
content: … em breve

title: Pré-requisitos
content:
updated: 2019-05-12
Para MACOS Instale KUBECTL brew install kubectl  Instale e configure o AWSCLI Baixe o bundle do AWSCLI do repositório oficial
curl "https://s3.amazonaws.com/aws-cli/awscli-bundle.zip" -o "awscli-bundle.zip"  Descompacte o pacote
unzip awscli-bundle.zip  Instale utilizando o commando abaixo
sudo ./awscli-bundle/install -i /usr/local/aws -b /usr/local/bin/aws  Mais informação no link
Instalação EKSCTL Utilizando brew, instale o repositorio e depois instale o eksctl
brew tap weaveworks/tap brew install weaveworks/tap/eksctl  Verifique a instalação:
eksctl version

title: Criando o cluster EKS
content:
updated: 2019-05-12
Criação do cluster EKS Criação do cluster EKS
eksctl create cluster --name=eksworkshop-eksctl --nodes=3 --node-ami=auto --region=${AWS_REGION}  Entre no console do CloudFormation e copie o ServiceRoleARN, iremos utilizar esse id no arquivo abaixo.
Configuração do KUBECTL Crie o arquivo aws-auth-cm.yaml
apiVersion: v1 kind: ConfigMap metadata: name: aws-auth namespace: kube-system data: mapRoles: | - rolearn: <COLOQUE O ID DO SERVICE ROLE ARN DO CLOUD FORMATION AQUI> username: system:node:{{EC2PrivateDNSName}} groups: - system:bootstrappers - system:nodes  Configure o KUBECTL utilizando arquivo criado acima
kubectl apply -f aws-auth-cm.yaml  Verifique se o kuibectl está funcionando e check os nodes
kubectl get nodes  Configure o Dashboard Instale o dashboard oficial
kubectl apply -f https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubernetes/dashboard/v1.10.1/src/deploy/recommended/kubernetes-dashboard.yaml  Execute o proxy
kubectl proxy &  Pegue o token de segurança para acesso ao proxy
kubectl -n kube-system describe secret $(kubectl -n kube-system get secret | grep eks-admin | awk '{print $1}')

title: Direct Connect
content: Sobre  Compatível com todos os serviços AWS que acessam a internet. Reduz custos de transferência out-bound com o ambiente de cloud, custos de in-bound se mantém gratuitos. Página principal do produto: https://aws.amazon.com/directconnect/  Casos de uso  Quantidades massivas de dados, quando é necessário mover grandes quantidades de dados sistematicamente. Workloads de vídeo, voz streamming, entre outros. Ambientes híbridos, quando é necessário interligar ambientes off-prem com a cloud.  Preço  Preço é composto por 2 componentes:  porta de acesso (1G ou 10G ) custo do tráfego out-bound   Vídeos  (NET301) Extending Data Centers to the Cloud: Connectivity Options and Co  Documentos  (NET201) VPC Fundamentals and Connectivity Options (NET406) Deep Dive: AWS Direct Connect and VPNs

content: Unicorn Ranch Project Essa página é uma inicativa de auxiliar parceiros e clientes na utilização das soluções AWS.

title: Configurando Launch Group
content:
updated: 2019-11-12
Criação do ASG Launch Configuration  Procure por uma imagem chamada ECS-Optmized e selecione essa imagem:  Selecione o tipo de instância:  Click em “Advance Details” e declare o nome do cluster em User Data:   #!/bin/bash echo ECS_CLUSTER=NOME_DO_CLUSTER >> /etc/ecs/ecs.config   Selecione o Storage:  Selecione o Security Group:  Click em launch configuration:  Selecione a public key:   Criação do ASG Launch Configuration

title: Requirements
content:
On premises environment  Hardware  at least one servers with 8 Cores and 64 GB RAM  Software
 VMware VCenter 6.5 + ESXi + VMware HCX ( NSX is not required for this lab )   On VMware Cloud on AWS  The stack created is enough, just need to deploy the HCX on portal and open the firewall ports to access the vCenter and HCX, I’ll explain it in the next chapter  (fast draft of requirements)

title: Criando AutoScaling Group
content:
updated: 2019-11-12
Criando o Auto Scaling Group  Acesse o console em Auto Scaling Group.
 Procure pela Configuração do Auto Scaling:  Dê um nome ao ASG:  Click em Configure Notifications:  Click em Configure TAGs:  Click Review:  Click Auto Scaling Group:  Click Close:   Verifique se as instâncias estão disponíveis no cluster de ECS  Acesse o console do ECS:  Selecione o cluster e verifique se há instâncias na aba ECS:

title: Creating a SDDC
content:
Click on CREATE SDDC.  Set properties:
 Set AWS Region, Set Deployment size, Set SDDC.   Connect to AWS:
 Set AWS Account   VPC and subnet:
 Select VPC; Select subnet.   Set management subnet.  Check acknowledge cost.  Check status on SDDC Console.

title: Deploying HCX on VMC at AWS
content:
Deploying HCX on VMC at AWS  Enter into VMC Console
 Found the tools tab.  Click in to deploy HCX.  After some minutes, your HCX is ready.  Open HCX.  Enter the same credentials provided for vCenter.

title: VMware on AWS
content: VMware Cloud on AWS  This site is a repository of tutorials to use VMWare products over AWS.

title: Projetos
content: Produtos e Soluções Nessa sessão, iremos detalhar os produtos e as soluções disponíveis e aonde é possível obter mais informações.

title: Deploying HCX on-premises
content:
Create the Activation Key for HCX  Enter into VMC Console
 Open HCX Console.  Open HCX.  Enter the same credentials provided for vCenter.  Click on Activation Keys Tab  Click on Create Activation button.  Confirm the creation of the key.  Found the new activation key, this is the key you’ll use to activate your HCX on-prem.   Download the HCX appliance  Enter into VMC Console
 Open HCX Console.  Open HCX.  Enter the same credentials provided for vCenter.  Click on System Updates tab  Click on Request Download Link  Click on VMware HCX button to download de OVA  Deploy the HCX using OVA menu at vSphere Client as usual.

title: Site pairing
content:
Open the HCX Console on-premises
 Login into HCX Console.  Click on Connect to Remote Site.  Add HCX endpoint, user and password and click on Connect.  Check the status on site pairing.

title: Network Profile
content:
Open the HCX Console on-premises
 Login into HCX Console.  Click on CREATE NETWORK PROFILE.  Create network profile:
 Set vCenter IP/Hostname; Select the network; Set IP Range (CIDR), gateway and DNS; Click on create.

title: Compute Profile
content:
Open the HCX Console on-premises
 Login into HCX Console.  Click on CREATE COMPUTE PROFILE.  Set computer profile name.  Select services.  Select resources and datastore to be used by profile.  Select management network profile.  Select Uplink.  Select VMotion Network.  Select Replication Network.  Select Distributed Switch to be used by network extension.  Review.  Finish the creation of compute profile.  Check the status of compute profile.

title: Service Mesh
content:
Open the HCX Console on-premises
 Login into HCX Console.  Click on CREATE SERVICE MESH.  Select sites.  Select compute profile.  Select services to be enabled.  Click on continue.  Click on continue.  Select bandwidth limit.  Review the service mesh configuration.  Select name for service mesh.  Check the deploy of service mesh at console.  Check the service mesh status at console.

title: Extending Networking
content:
Open the HCX Console on-premises
 Login into HCX Console.  Click on Network Extension  Extending:
 Select the DSwitch vlan do you want extend Set the default gateway from this subnet Click into Extend button   Confirm the extend is correct.

title: Bulk Migration
content:
Open the HCX Console on-premises
 Login into HCX Console.  Click on Migration tab.  At the HXC: Migrate Virtual Machines:
 select the VM Name to migration select storage at VMC on AWS select the type of migration select the network at VMC on AWS click in Finish button   Check the status at migration console.
